title: 114_hr4721
content: The "Airport and Airway Extension Act of 2016" includes provisions for airport improvement programs, extension of expiring authorities, FAA operations, air navigation facilities, research and development, compliance with aviation funding requirements, and essential air service. It also covers revenue provisions related to the Airport and Airway Trust Fund. The "Airport and Airway Extension Act of 2016" extends the Airport Improvement Program by increasing the authorization of appropriations to $2,652,083,333 until July 15, 2016. The funds can be obligated until September 30, 2016, and remain available for expenditure. The Administrator of the Federal Aviation Administration shall calculate funding apportionments based on a total amount of $3,350,000,000 for fiscal year 2016 and reduce them by 20.83 percent. Section 47104(c) of title 49, United States Code, is amended to extend project grant authority until July 15, 2016. Section 47107(r)(3) of title 49, United States Code, is also amended. Section 47107(r)(3), 47115(j), 47124(b)(3)(E), 47141(f), 186(d), and 409(d) of title 49, United States Code, are all amended to change dates from March 31, 2016, to July 15, 2016. The Reauthorization Act is amended to change dates from March 31, 2016, to July 15, 2016 for various sections. This includes amendments to the FAA Modernization and Reform Act of 2012. Additionally, funding for the Federal Aviation Administration operations is adjusted to end on July 15, 2016. SEC. 104 amends the budget authority for air navigation facilities and equipment to end on July 15, 2016. SEC. 105 adjusts the funding for research, engineering, and development to also end on July 15, 2016. SEC. 106 states that the budget authority authorized in this Act satisfies aviation funding requirements until July 15, 2016. SEC. 107 amends the Essential Air Service budget to $122,708,333 for the period from October 1, 2015, to July 15, 2016. TITLE II--REVENUE PROVISIONS SEC. 201 amends the expenditure authority from the Airport and Airway Trust Fund by changing dates in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. SEC. 202 extends fuel and ticket taxes funding the Airport and Airway Trust Fund by changing dates in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. SEC. 201 and SEC. 202 amend dates in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 related to the Airport and Airway Trust Fund, changing deadlines for various tax provisions.
